Alias of the analytic view dimension in the analytic view; for a measure the value is MEASURES
Alias of the analytic view hierarchy within DIMENSION_NAME in the analytic view; for a measure the value is MEASURES

The role the attribute plays in the analytic view:

  • KEY

  • AKEY

  • HIER

  • PROP

  • MEAS
Decimal precision for the NUMBER datatype; binary precision for the FLOAT datatype, NULL for all other datatypes
Number of digits to the right of the decimal point in a number
Indicates whether a column allows NULL values; the value is N if there is a NOT NULL constraint on the column or if the column is part of a PRIMARYKEY

Name of the character set:

  • CHAR_CS

  • NCHAR_CS
Declaration length of the character type column

Indicates that the column uses BYTE length semantics (B) or CHAR length semantics (C), or whether the datatype is not any of the following (NULL):

  • CHAR

  • VARCHAR2

  • NCHAR

  • NVARCHAR2

Order of the column, with the hierarchy columns first followed by measure columns. The columns for a hierarchy are grouped together, listed in their order in the HIERARCHIES clause of the analytic view definition. Within a hierarchy, attributes are listed first in order of their definition in the ATTRIBUTES clause of the attribute dimension definition followed by hierarchical attributes in the DIMENSION BY clause of the analytic view.

The ID of the container where the data originates. Possible values include:

  • 0: This value is used for rows in non-CDBs. This value is not used for CDBs.

  • n: This value is used for rows containing data that originate in the container with container ID n (n = 1 if the row originates in root).
